issues.title: IMS Bearing Failure (987.1 Only)
issues.symptoms: Metallic debris in oil, grinding noise, oil pressure warning, catastrophic engine failure
issues.description: The 987.1 (2005-2008) uses the M97 engine which has the IMS (intermediate shaft) bearing that can fail. This dual-row bearing supports the intermediate shaft that drives the camshafts. When it fails, metal debris contaminates the engine and failure is catastrophic. The 987.2 (2009+) uses a different engine design with no IMS bearing concern.
fixes: 987.1: Proactive IMS bearing replacement highly recommended
LN Engineering or IMS Retrofit single-row bearing upgrade
Regular oil analysis to detect early bearing wear
987.2: No IMS bearing - not a concern on these models
Always verify production date when purchasing a 987

repairCosts.notes: 987.1 only (M97). 987.2 has different design - no IMS concern.

issues.title: Bore Scoring / Cylinder Wear (987.1)
issues.symptoms: Ticking/knocking noise, smoke on cold start, excessive oil consumption, low compression
issues.description: The M97 engine in the 987.1 can develop cylinder bore scoring, where the cylinder walls become damaged, allowing oil to bypass the piston rings. Cylinder 6 is most commonly affected due to cooling system design. The 987.2 with the MA1 engine has improved cooling and does not have this issue.
fixes: Borescope inspection essential for pre-purchase (987.1)
Minor scoring: monitor with oil analysis, use quality oil
Moderate scoring: cylinder sleeving by specialists
Severe scoring: engine rebuild or replacement
Prevention: proper warm-up, quality oil, avoid short trips

issues.title: Rear Main Seal Leak (987.1)
issues.symptoms: Oil drips from bell housing area, oil smell, clutch slipping (manual), burning oil smell
issues.description: The M97 engine in the 987.1 can develop rear main seal (RMS) leaks, similar to the 997.1. Oil leaks onto the clutch in manual transmission cars, causing slippage. The leak can also affect the intermediate plate seal. This is less common in the 987.2.
fixes: Rear main seal replacement (requires transmission removal)
Replace clutch if contaminated with oil
Often combined with IMS bearing upgrade to save labor
Use updated seal design for longer service life
Inspect intermediate plate seal while apart

issues.title: Air/Oil Separator (AOS) Failure
issues.symptoms: Smoke from exhaust, oil consumption, rough idle, check engine light, vacuum leaks
issues.description: The AOS separates oil vapor from crankcase gases. When it fails, oil is drawn into the intake manifold and burned, causing smoke and consumption. The AOS diaphragm can also tear, creating a vacuum leak that affects idle quality. This affects both 987.1 and 987.2 models.
fixes: AOS replacement (located under intake manifold)
Replace vacuum lines while accessible
Updated AOS design available for better durability
Check for collateral damage from oil in intake
Clean throttle body if oil contaminated

repairCosts.notes: Both 987.1 and 987.2 can have AOS issues.

issues.title: Coolant Pipe and System Failures
issues.symptoms: Coolant loss, overheating, coolant warning, sweet smell, puddles under car
issues.description: The 987's mid-engine layout requires long coolant runs from the front-mounted radiators to the rear engine. Plastic coolant pipes, water pump, and expansion tank all degrade with heat and age. Coolant pipe failure can cause overheating and engine damage if not addressed immediately.
fixes: Replace plastic coolant pipes with aluminum upgrade
Replace water pump with metal impeller version
New expansion tank (common failure point)
Replace thermostat during cooling system work
Flush and refill with proper coolant mix

repairCosts.notes: Same plastic pipe issues as 986. Aluminum upgrade available.

issues.title: Convertible Top Issues (Boxster)
issues.symptoms: Top won't open/close, slow operation, error messages, hydraulic leaks, torn fabric
issues.description: The Boxster's power convertible top is complex and can develop issues. The hydraulic pump and rams wear, causing slow operation or failure to complete cycles. Microswitches fail, preventing operation. The fabric top itself wears and can develop tears or leaks at seams and the rear window.
fixes: Hydraulic fluid top-off (use correct fluid)
Hydraulic pump and ram replacement
Microswitch adjustment or replacement
Top fabric replacement for tears or worn seams
Rear window replacement if delaminating
Convertible top reset procedure after battery disconnect

repairCosts.notes: Boxster only. Hydraulic system issues common.

issues.title: Carbon Buildup on Intake Valves (987.2 DFI)
issues.symptoms: Rough idle, misfires, reduced power, hesitation, poor fuel economy
issues.description: The 987.2 uses direct fuel injection (DFI) which doesn't wash the intake valves with fuel. Over time, carbon deposits accumulate on the intake valves, affecting airflow and combustion. This requires periodic cleaning via walnut shell blasting, typically every 50,000-80,000 miles.
fixes: Walnut shell blasting to remove carbon deposits
Chemical treatments (less effective but less invasive)
Catch can installation to reduce oil vapor deposits
Use quality fuel with good detergent additives
Periodic spirited driving to help burn off deposits

repairCosts.notes: 987.2 DFI engines. Walnut blasting every 50-80k miles.

issues.title: Window Regulator Failure
issues.symptoms: Window won't go up/down, grinding noise, slow window operation, window drops
issues.description: The 987's frameless windows use regulators that wear over time. The cable-driven regulators can fail, causing the window to drop or operate erratically. Since the windows must drop slightly for the door to open and close, a failed regulator can make it difficult to close the door properly.
fixes: Window regulator replacement
Motor replacement if regulator is intact but motor failed
Check door seal condition when windows are serviced
Lubricate window guides during service
Window reset procedure after replacement

repairCosts.notes: Frameless windows. Adjustment and regulator issues.

guides.title: Complete Suspension Refresh
guides.description: Full front and rear suspension rebuild for the 987 Boxster/Cayman's MacPherson strut front and multi-link rear suspension, restoring precise handling.
steps: Raise vehicle and support on jack stands at all four corners.
Remove all wheels and photograph suspension for reference.
Soak all suspension bolts with penetrating oil.
Front: Remove sway bar end links, tie rod ends, and control arm bolts.
Separate ball joint from knuckle using separator tool.
For struts: mark camber position, remove upper mount nuts and pinch bolt.
Use spring compressor to replace strut mount/bearing.
Install new front components - torque control arm to 89 ft-lbs.
Rear: Support trailing arm before removing control arm bolts.
Replace upper and lower control arms - torque at ride height.
Check for cracked spring perches (known issue).
Install wheels and lower vehicle.
Professional alignment mandatory.
tips: The 987 shares suspension with 997 but has mid-engine weight distribution.
Check spring perches for cracks - common issue.
Cayman has fixed roof = stiffer chassis than Boxster.
Consider PASM shock replacement if equipped and leaking.
warnings: Spring compressors are dangerous - follow instructions.
Mid-engine cars are sensitive to alignment.
PASM shocks require diagnostic tool to calibrate.

guides.title: Rust Prevention and Inspection
guides.description: Comprehensive rust inspection guide for the 987, which is fully galvanized but still requires attention to water intrusion and drain systems.
steps: The 987 is galvanized and generally rust-resistant.
Clean undercarriage before inspection.
Check front trunk for water intrusion - DME and fuse box located here.
Inspect battery box for acid corrosion.
Boxster: Check convertible top drains - clogs cause interior damage.
Examine door bottoms and rocker panels.
Check wheel wells for debris damage.
Surface rust: wire brush, convert, prime, topcoat.
Apply cavity wax to hollow sections annually.
Clear all drain tubes with compressed air.
tips: Most 987 rust is from water intrusion, not structural.
Front trunk contains expensive electronics.
Boxster drains must be kept clear.
Annual Fluid Film prevents most issues.

guides.title: Electrical System Service
guides.description: Complete electrical service for the 987 covering ignition, sensors, and common electrical issues including window regulators and convertible top systems.
steps: Begin with diagnostic scan for fault codes.
Check front trunk for water intrusion.
For coil replacement: open engine lid, disconnect and remove coils.
Inspect spark plug wells for oil contamination.
For MAF: clean with MAF-specific cleaner only.
For window regulator: remove door panel, support glass, swap regulator.
Boxster top issues: check hydraulic fluid level first.
Clean all ground points with wire brush.
Clear codes and verify repairs.
tips: Many electrical issues trace to water damage in frunk.
987.1 and 987.2 have different oil filter locations.
Frameless windows require precise adjustment.
Durametric scanner provides much better diagnosis.
warnings: Never use carburetor cleaner on MAF.
Support window glass before removing regulator.

guides.title: Interior Restoration
guides.description: Complete interior refresh for the 987 Boxster/Cayman covering leather care, convertible top maintenance, and common wear items.
steps: Document condition with photos.
Clean leather thoroughly with dedicated cleaner.
Fill cracks with leather filler, sand, dye.
Condition all leather surfaces.
Boxster: Clean top fabric with specific cleaner.
Inspect and treat fabric with protectant.
Check hydraulic fluid level in reservoir.
Lubricate top mechanism pivot points.
Replace worn boots and knobs.
Replace cabin air filter.
Apply UV protectant to exposed surfaces.
tips: 987 leather responds well to conditioning.
Sport seats wear faster on driver bolster.
Convertible hydraulic fluid often overlooked.
Cayman has less top mechanism but same interior.
warnings: Never operate top when wet or freezing.
Be careful with aged trim clips.

diyGuides.title: Oil Change
diyGuides.description: Complete oil and filter change for M97 and MA1 engines.
tools: Ramps or jack and jack stands
steps: Warm the engine for 2-3 minutes - warm oil drains better.
Drive onto ramps or raise and support the car safely.
Locate the oil drain plug on the bottom of the engine.
Position drain pan and remove the drain plug.
Allow oil to drain completely - at least 10 minutes.
987.1: Spin-on filter under the car. 987.2: Cartridge filter on top.
Remove old filter. For 987.2, unscrew housing cap with 76mm tool.
987.1: Cut open old filter and inspect for metal debris (IMS check).
Apply fresh oil to new filter's gasket (987.1) or replace O-ring (987.2).
Install new filter. 987.2: Insert cartridge and torque cap to 19 ft-lbs.
Replace the copper crush washer on the drain plug.
Reinstall drain plug and torque to 37 ft-lbs (50 Nm).
Add 8-9 quarts of 0W-40 or 5W-40 synthetic oil.
Start engine, check for leaks, verify level.
tips: 987.1: Cut open filter and inspect for metal debris (IMS warning sign).
987.2 has no IMS concern - uses different engine design.
Use quality synthetic oil meeting Porsche A40 specification.
The 987.2 uses a top-mounted cartridge filter like BMW.

diyGuides.title: Brake Pad Replacement
diyGuides.description: Front and rear brake pad replacement on the 987's Brembo calipers.
steps: Loosen lug bolts while car is on the ground.
Raise and support the car safely on jack stands.
Remove wheel to access caliper.
Disconnect brake pad wear sensor if equipped.
Remove the two 7mm Allen caliper guide pin bolts.
Swing the caliper up and support it - don't let it hang by the hose.
Remove the old pads from the caliper bracket.
Inspect rotor for scoring, cracks, or minimum thickness.
Clean pad contact surfaces with wire brush and brake cleaner.
Open brake fluid reservoir, then compress caliper piston(s).
Apply brake grease to pad backing plate contact points.
Install new pads - wear sensor slot goes on the inner pad.
Swing caliper down and reinstall guide pins to 22 ft-lbs (30 Nm).
Reconnect wear sensor.
Reinstall wheel and torque lugs to 96-118 ft-lbs.
Repeat for all corners.
Pump brake pedal until firm before driving.
tips: S models have larger brakes than base models.
Four-piston calipers require all pistons pushed back evenly.
Bed new pads with moderate stops - avoid hard braking initially.
Wear sensors should be replaced with new pads.

diyGuides.title: Spark Plug Replacement
diyGuides.description: Replace spark plugs on the M97 or MA1 flat-six engine.
steps: Allow engine to cool completely.
Open the engine lid for access.
The 987 has 6 spark plugs - accessed from the top of the engine.
Remove the coil packs by disconnecting connectors and removing bolts.
Use compressed air to blow debris from the spark plug wells.
Using spark plug socket and extension, remove each plug.
Inspect old plugs for wear, fouling, or damage.
Check plug gap on new plugs - should be 0.7-0.8mm.
Hand-thread new plugs to avoid cross-threading.
Torque plugs to 22 ft-lbs (30 Nm).
Apply dielectric grease to coil pack boots.
Reinstall coil packs and torque bolts to 7 ft-lbs (10 Nm).
Start engine and verify smooth operation.
tips: Use NGK or Bosch platinum/iridium plugs specified for your engine.
Both 987.1 and 987.2 use coil-on-plug ignition.
Inspect coil boots for cracks while replacing plugs.
Replace coils if you're experiencing misfires.

diyGuides.title: Serpentine Belt Replacement
diyGuides.description: Replace accessory drive belt and inspect tensioner.
steps: Open engine lid and locate the serpentine belt.
Note or photograph the belt routing before removal.
Locate the automatic belt tensioner with 19mm bolt head.
Using the wrench, rotate the tensioner to release belt tension.
Slip the old belt off the pulleys while holding tensioner back.
Slowly release the tensioner.
Inspect the old belt for cracks, glazing, or missing ribs.
Inspect the tensioner pulley - spin it by hand for roughness or play.
Route the new belt according to the diagram.
Leave the tensioner pulley for last.
Rotate the tensioner and slip the belt over the tensioner pulley.
Release the tensioner slowly to take up slack.
Verify the belt is properly seated in all pulley grooves.
Start engine and observe belt tracking.
tips: Take a photo of belt routing before removal.
If the tensioner pulley is noisy, replace it with the belt.
Check idler pulleys for smooth rotation while belt is off.
A cracked belt can leave you stranded - replace proactively.

buyersGuide.overview: The Porsche 987 Boxster/Cayman (2005-2012) represents a significant evolution from the 986, with improved styling, more power, and the addition of the Cayman coupe variant. The mid-engine layout delivers exceptional handling, and many consider the Cayman one of the best-handling cars Porsche has ever made. Like the 997, the 987.1 (2005-2008) has IMS bearing concerns while the 987.2 (2009-2012) with DFI engines does not. The Cayman R and Boxster Spyder are particularly desirable.

variants.name: Boxster / Cayman
variants.description: Base models with 2.7L (240-255 hp) or 2.9L (255 hp). Excellent entry point.

variants.name: Boxster S / Cayman S
variants.description: Performance models with 3.2L/3.4L (295-320 hp). Better brakes, LSD available.

variants.name: Cayman R
variants.description: Lightweight special with 330 hp, sport suspension, and bucket seats. The driver's choice.

variants.name: Boxster Spyder
variants.description: Lightweight roadster with manual top, 320 hp, and aggressive styling. Very desirable.

items.detail: 987.1 (2005-2008) has improved IMS bearing but failure is still possible. Verify if retrofitted.
M97 engine can develop bore scoring. Listen for knocking, check for smoke.
Some consumption is normal. Excessive consumption indicates bore issues.
987.2 (2009-2012) DFI engines have no IMS bearing. Major reliability improvement.
DFI engines can develop intake valve carbon deposits at high mileage.
DFI injectors can fail causing rough running.
6-speed manual is robust and engaging. Test all gears.
Dual-clutch is fast and smooth. Check for shudder or harsh engagement.
Manual clutch should engage smoothly. Mid-engine makes replacement easier.
Test operation. Hydraulics and cables can fail.
Spyder has manual top. Check fabric and frame condition.
Test both windows. Less problematic than 986 but can fail.
If equipped, test in all modes. Shocks can develop leaks.
Common wear item causing clunks and handling issues.
